definitions.definition: In the International System of Units , the base unit of thermodynamic temperature ; ⁄ 273.16 of the thermodynamic temperature of the triple point of water .
A measurement of color warmth defined by the temperature kelvin at which an incandescent blackbody would emit a given color.
A unit interval on the Kelvin scale .
examples: The interval between the freezing and boiling points of water is 100 kelvins .

definitions.definition: A unit for a specific temperature on the Kelvin scale .

main_definition: In the International System of Units , the base unit of thermodynamic temperature ; ⁄ 273.16 of the thermodynamic temperature of the triple point of water .
secondary_definitions: A measurement of color warmth defined by the temperature kelvin at which an incandescent blackbody would emit a given color.
A unit interval on the Kelvin scale .
( usually as postpositioned adjective ) A unit for a specific temperature on the Kelvin scale .
